refnamediv.refpurpose: remove unused parts from the data specification of an LPE

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The &lpedataelm; tool removes unused parts from the data specification from a linear process equation (LPE). It reads the LPE from &infile; and writes the result to &outfile;. If &outfile; is not present, &stdout; is used. If &infile; is not present, &stdin; is used.

Unused parts are sorts, constructors, mappings and data equations that do not take part in the behavioural description of the LPE. Removal of these parts makes the LPE more compact, which has the following advantages:
The speed of initialisation of the rewriters increases significantly, in particular the compilation time of the compiling rewriters. Note that data elimination is performed automatically when using the tool &lpe2lts;.
When pretty printing the LPE using &lpepp;, the resulting specification is smaller.
